title: Nike falls following boycott calls in China over statement about forced labor of Uyghurs
text: Nike shares dropped Thursday as the company faced calls for boycotts and received backlash on social media sites in China over the company's statement that it would not use cotton from a disputed region. The sportswear company in a statement highlighted reports of forced labor of Uyghurs, a Muslim ethnic minority, in the Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region. Nike said it does not source products from the region and that it has "confirmed with our contract suppliers that they are not using textiles or spun yarn from the region."

title: CROSS COUNTRY: The Woodlands dominates Nike South Invitational
text: THE WOODLANDS — The Nike South Invitational looked much different this year due to the new coronavirus protocols. But that didn’t stop the competing athletes from enjoying themselves on the 3.1-mile course on a brisk Saturday morning at the Bear Branch Sports Fields. The Woodlands hosts Nike South every year, bringing in dozens of teams and elite runners from around the state. This time around, the numbers were drastically reduced after the UIL dictated that only eight teams are allowed to compete at each cross country meet. “I know the kids were really excited,” said The Woodlands coach Juris Green, whose girls and boys teams both took first place in the varsity races. “I’ve heard from coaches from other schools about how excited their kids were as well when they knew they were coming here. It’s not the same. It’s a different course, different setup, different equipment, a little bit more of a shoestring budget this year. But the funny thing is, the excitement is still there when the kids line up.” Nike South spanned two days this year, and three races were held Friday evening. The varsity races took place first thing Saturday morning and were followed by three more sub-varsity competitions. In accordance with the UIL guidelines, runners and their supporters left the park following each race to avoid large crowds. Despite those changes, Green was pleased with how everything went. “We’d love to have double the numbers, or even more, but the teams that came, they were invited because they had quality, they would bring the whole house and we could fill up some races,” Green said. “The kids are happy, and I think right now, from an educator’s standpoint, that should be one of the first things you should do —...

text: The World Cup isn't just a competition between countries. It's also a battlefield between brands. Adidas is the reigning champ when it comes to soccer. And Nike has been going after the German outfitter on its own turf — the World Cup. Nike sponsored six teams in 1998 and now it's at 10 for 2018. Adidas still has a edge though. In 2018, Adidas represents 12 teams and the last two teams that won the World Cup — Germany and Spain.

title: How to Make Money Off Nike's Blowout Earnings
text: Nike smashed Wall Street profit forecasts on Thursday. That could mean good things for retailer Foot Locker FL .

title: The Nike Shoe Inspired by a Building in Paris
text: Behind the Design is a series of sleek and concise videos about the design of everyday objects we take for granted. This episode tells the story of how radical architecture gave a designer the idea behind Nike's most iconic sneakers.
